page.title: 03Kirkton Farm.
page.content: Mr Hamilton came to Kirkton Farm 24 years ago.He owns 750 acres of land. Most of the land is stock and hill land and the rest is arable.Mr Hamilton says that to be a good farmer you need to be a good stockman. On Mr Hamilton's farm,over the last ten years,he has reclaimed more ground which gives him more arable and stock land.Mr Hamilton owns Aberdeen Angus cross cattle and Black-face sheep,some of which are cross bred and some pure bred.Mr Hamilton's crops are good this year although they have not been harvested yet. Next to Kirkton Farm house is a graveyard.It was probably the first graveyard in Crawford.It was first used in 1621 and the last burial was in 1940.
